title: Sodium sulfide
summary: Sodium sulfide is the chemical compound with the formula Na2S, or more commonly its hydrate Na2SÂ·9H2O. Both the anhydrous and the hydrated salts are colorless solids.  They are water-soluble, giving strongly alkaline solutions.  When exposed to moist air, Na2S and its hydrates emit hydrogen sulfide, which smells like rotten eggs.
